metadata.title: CVE-2011-4131 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The NFSv4 implementation in the Linux kernel before 3.2.2 does not properlyhandle bitmap sizes in GETACL replies, which allows remote NFS servers tocause a denial of service (OOPS) by sending an excessive number of bitmapwords.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.9
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-3-mako - 3.4.0-3.21
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-4-manta - 3.4.0-4.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required
